meanings.definition: Relating to or involving analysis or description of cultural phenomena from the perspective of an observer outside the culture being studied.
meanings.sent1: The researcher took an etic approach when studying the tribal customs.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consider etic viewpoints when analyzing different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The etic perspective provided a fresh insight into the ancient traditions.
meanings.sent4: Her etic interpretation of the rituals shed light on their significance.
meanings.sent5: The etic analysis revealed intriguing patterns in the cultural practices.

meanings.definition: A phonetic symbol representing a sound not occurring in English.
meanings.sent1: The linguist used an etic to represent the unique sound in the language.
meanings.sent2: In phonetics, an etic is used to denote non-English sounds.
meanings.sent3: The student found the etic symbol fascinating in their language class.
meanings.sent4: The etic on the chart stood out as a symbol of foreign pronunciation.
meanings.sent5: Learning to recognize the etic helped improve the pronunciation skills.
